intro: Lessertia capitata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble tulips. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange and bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant is well adapted to arid conditions and thrives in full sun.
